column1: ..."And so I leave my stocks and bonds, worth an estimate fourteen dollars and twelve cents, to be divided amongst my loving family."
"To my loving son, Stinky: I leave you the house in Nebraska. Look after it as your father and I did."
"To my grandson Eric: You are always my favorite fat little man, my perfect round little pudding-piler."
"For you, Eric, I leave from my life savings, the sum of one million dollars, to be transferred to you immediately."
"Eric is the primary benefactor of my estate, since it is likely the rest of you would spend the money on crack."
